Detailed Description

IO class.

This class is used for sloppy database input and output. It is extended by other objects to provide the user with a simple way to add fields to an object. Currently it can only interact with a single table.

The Boo ID concept is a generic reference to the unique ID for each row of a given table. In a typical table of users the Boo ID would likely be the user ID column. If no unique column exists for a given table then you should create a column called boo_id and designate it an autonumber and primary key (try phpMyAdmin for this). The Boo ID will be the value of the column designated by Boo_Io::setPrimaryKey().

License:
http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0.txt GNU General Public License
Link:
http://code.ramaboo.com/ Boo Framework

Version:

Definition at line 1665 of file Io.php.

Boo_Io::preloadPost ( $  override = true  ) 

Preloads values from fields into $_POST.

This only works well if the $_POST keys are the same as Boo_Io fields. Using Boo_Html_Form_Xml::preloadPost() is safer for many uses.

See also:
Boo_Html_Form_Xml::preloadPost()
Parameters:
bool $override[optional] Override existing values.
Returns:
bool Returns TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise.

Boo_Io::setIgnoredFields ( array $  fields  ) 

Sets the list of ignored fields.

Member Data Documentation

Boo_Io::$arrayFields = array() [protected]

Array fields list.

Boo will automaticly store and retrieve these fileds while still allowing SQL queries in the following form: SELECT * FROM table_name WHERE value LIKE '|search|';

Attention:
This method violates table normalization rules. In most cases you should use joins instead.
Warning:
Only stores array values, keys are permanently lost.

Definition at line 76 of file Io.php.

Boo_Io::$booId = false [protected]

Boo ID.

The Boo ID is a unique ID for each item, usualy the primary key of a table.

Definition at line 83 of file Io.php.

Referenced by beforeOpen(), exists(), open(), saveAs(), and setBooId().

Boo_Io::$encryptedFields = array() [protected]

Encrypted fields list.

Boo will encrypt fields on this list with BOO_AES_KEY before saving into database. Fields will be unencrypted when opened.

Definition at line 37 of file Io.php.

Boo_Io::$fields = array() [protected]

Fields list.

Keys are field names, values are the field values.

Boo_Io::$handledMagicFields [protected]

        'created', 'modified', 'uuid', 'ip')

List of magic fields that this class handles.

Definition at line 57 of file Io.php.

Boo_Io::$ignoredFields = array() [protected]

Ignored fields list.

Numerically indexed array of field names to ignore. Boo will not save fields on this list, however it will store them during the same instance.

Definition at line 45 of file Io.php.

Boo_Io::$magicFields = array() [protected]

Magic field list.

Boo will automaticly manipulated these fields.

Boo_Io::$serializedFields = array() [protected]

Serialized fields list.

Boo will automaticly serialize and unserialize these fileds.
